meanings.definition: Very small or tiny in size.
meanings.sent1: The ant carried a miniscule crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent2: The miniscule flower bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a giant when I held the miniscule pencil in my hand.
meanings.sent4: Her miniscule voice was barely audible over the loud music.
meanings.sent5: The miniscule stars twinkled in the vast night sky.

meanings.sent1: The miniscule error in the report went unnoticed by most people.
meanings.sent2: His miniscule contribution to the project was still appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The miniscule frog tried to hop like a giant toad.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, her miniscule mistake didn't matter much.
meanings.sent5: The miniscule crack in the wall grew into a major problem over time.
